授業目的: This course has the aim to introduce social issues in relation to diversity and inclusion. We will address both personal experience, policy and practice taking examples from Japan and the US and UK. We will think about questions such as: What are the experiences of children and young people with disability or chronic illness? What are the experiences of other minority children and young people? Who are they and how should we support them? How do we think about the challenges they face? Who should be responsible for supporting them? What systems do we need to create greater equality, participation and inclusion across diverse settings?
到達目標:
By the end of this course it is expected that students will:
1) Be able to recognize social issues in relation to diversity;
2) Better understand the subjective experience of being discriminated;
3) Be able to explain possible solutions as the social model of disability and inclusive　education;
4) Be able to reflect critically about possible weaknesses and limitations of those solutions;
5) Improve their ability to think critically and to collaborate with other students.
授業方法: Face to face format. The teaching will involve short interactive lecture sections followed by discussion of key points.
